text: This is a list of cancelled games for the Atari Lynx. == List == There are currently ' games on this list. {| class="wikitable sortable" id="softwarelist" width="auto" |- ! rowspan="2" | Title ! rowspan="2" | Genre ! rowspan="2" | Developer(s) ! rowspan="2" | Publisher(s) ! rowspan="2" | Planned Release Date/Last Year Developed or Mentioned ! rowspan="2" | Notes/Reasons |- ! id="0–9" style="text-align: left;"| 720° | Sports | | Atari Corporation | June 1992 | No prototype has surfaced. |- ! id="A" style="text-align: left;"| Alien vs Predator | First-person shooter | Images Software | Atari Corporation | | A more further developed build containing all three playable characters is planned to be sold by Beta Phase Games in the future. |- ! id="B" style="text-align: left;"| Barbarian Bodyguard | Action | Epyx | Atari Corporation | | Interview with its author revealed it was approximately 33% complete, however no screenshots are available and the source code is lost. |- ! style="text-align: left;"| Battletoads | Beat 'em up, Platform | Leland Interactive Media | Telegames | | No prototype has surfaced. |- ! style="text-align: left;"| Bleaker | Action, Adventure, Role- playing game | Digital Thunder | Digital Thunder | March 2003 | No prototype has surfaced. |- ! style="text-align: left;"| Blue Earth | Role-playing game | Digital Thunder | Digital Thunder | March 2003 | No prototype has surfaced. |- ! style="text-align: left;"| Blood & Guts Hockey | Sports | NuFX | Atari Corporation | 1992 | Artwork and screenshots exists but no prototype has surfaced. |- ! id="C" style="text-align: left;"| Cabal | Shooting gallery | Fabtek | Atari Corporation | April 1992 | Artwork and screenshots exists but no prototype has surfaced. |- ! id="D" style="text-align: left;"| Defender & Stargate Double Bill | Shoot 'em up | Shadowsoft | Williams Electronics | March 1993 | Compilation of Defender and Stargate. No prototype has surfaced. |- ! style="text-align: left;"| Dragnet | Demo | 42Bastian Schick | 42Bastian Schick | 1995 | ROM image was released online. |- ! style="text-align: left;"| Dungeon Slayers | Role-playing game | Atari Corporation | Atari Corporation | | Prototype exists but has not been made available online and source code currently resides with Harry Dodgson. |- ! style="text-align: left;"| Dyna Blaster | Action, Maze, Strategy | Ubi Soft | Ubi Soft | | Only a single screenshot exists and no prototype has surfaced. |- ! id="E" style="text- align: left;"| Edward 2000 | Breakout | Mr. Castle | Mr. Castle | | Development was halted and no screenshots nor prototype has surfaced. |- ! style="text-align: left;"| Escape from the Planet of the Robot Monsters | Shooter | Atari Corporation | Atari Corporation | March 2015 | Only a single screenshot exists. |- ! style="text-align: left;"| Evergreen | | JagSoft | JagSoft | March 2003 | No prototype has surfaced. |- ! id="F" style="text- align: left;"| Fire Power | Action | Silent Software | | | Interview with its author revealed that no actual development started on Lynx version due to internal conflict between Epyx. |- ! style="text-align: left;"| Full Court Press Basketball | Sports | Ringler Studios | Atari Corporation | 1992 | Artwork and screenshots exists but no prototype has surfaced. |- ! style="text-align: left;"| The Furies | Action | Digital Thunder | Digital Thunder | March 2003 | No prototype has surfaced. |- ! id="G" style="text- align: left;"| GeoDuel | Action | Atari Corporation | Atari Corporation | June 1992 | Artwork and screenshots exist but no prototype has surfaced online. |- ! style="text-align: left;"| Green-Thang | Platform, Run and gun | Creative Edge Software | Atari Corporation | | Also known as Frogs. |- ! style="text- align: left;"| The Guardians: Storm Over Doria | Role-playing game | Knight Technologies | Telegames | 1992 | 30% complete but no prototype has surfaced. |- ! id="H" style="text-align: left;"| Heavyweight Contender | Sports | Ringler Studios | Atari Corporation | 1992 | Artwork and screenshots exists but no prototype has surfaced. |- ! style="text-align: left;"| Hellraiser | Action, Maze, Puzzle | Color Dreams | Color Dreams | 1990 | Promotional flyer advertising the Lynx version exists but no prototype has surfaced. |- ! id="I" style="text-align: left;"| Iron Reign | Simulation, Strategy | Digital Thunder | Digital Thunder | March 2003 | No prototype has surfaced. |- ! id="J" style="text-align: left;"| Jimmy White's 'Whirlwind' Snooker | Sports | Archer Maclean | | February 1993 | Conversion of the home computer original. |- ! id="M" style="text-align: left;"| Marlboro Go! | Racing, Sports | Digital Image | Philip Morris USA | 1993 | ROM image was released online. |- ! style="text-align: left;"| Mechtiles | First-person shooter | Beyond Games | Atari Corporation | | Its ROM image and source code were preserved but have not been made available online. |- ! style="text-align: left;"| Metal Mutant | Action, Adventure | Silmarils | Atari Corporation | | Silmarils co-founder Louis-Marie Rocques stated its planned release was cancelled by Atari and no prototype has surfaced. |- ! id="P" style="text-align: left;"| ParaLemmings | Shooter | Laurens Simonis | Laurens Simonis | 1997 | ROM image was released online. |- ! style="text-align: left;"| Pitfall: The Mayan Adventure | Platform | Imagitec Design | Atari Corporation | | Development on the Lynx version was scrapped due to Atari Corp. focusing on the Jaguar instead and no prototype has surfaced. |- ! style="text-align: left;"| Pro Quarterback | Sports | Leland Interactive Media | | December 1992 | Unknown if actual development started on Lynx version. |- ! style="text-align: left;"| Puzzler 2000 | Puzzle | Markus Wuehl | Markus Wuehl | 1998 | ROM image was released online. |- ! id="R" style="text-align: left;"| Ren & Stimpy | | Acclaim Entertainment | | February 1993 | Based upon the eponymus animated series from Nickelodeon. |- ! style="text-align: left;"| Rolling Thunder | Run and gun | Atari Corporation | Telegames | November 1992 | Artwork and screenshots exists but no prototype has surfaced. |- ! id="S" style="text-align: left;"| Soccer Kid | Platform | | Telegames | | No prototype has surfaced. |- ! style="text- align: left;"| Space War | Space combat simulation | Atari Corporation | Atari Corporation | September 1995 | Artwork and screenshots exist but no prototype has surfaced online. |- ! style="text-align: left;"| Strider II | Action, Platform | Tiertex Design Studios | U.S. Gold | July 1991 | 50% complete but no prototype has surfaced. |- ! id="T" style="text-align: left;"| TNT Terry | Action, Maze, Strategy | Laurens Simonis, Yiri T. Kohl | Laurens Simonis | | Prototype exists but has not been made available online. |- ! id="U" style="text-align: left;"| Ultra Vortex | Fighting | Beyond Games | Atari Corporation | 1994 | Prototype exists but has not been made available online. |- ! id="V" style="text-align: left;"| Vindicators | Run and gun | Atari Corporation | Atari Corporation | | Prototype exists but has not been made available online. |- ! id="W" style="text-align: left;"| Wolfenstein 3D | First-person shooter | id Software | Atari Corporation | | No actual development started on Lynx version due to an unrealized deal between id and Atari that was never fully instigated. |} == See also == * List of Atari Lynx games * Lists of video games == Notes == == References == * Atari Lynx
title: List of cancelled Atari Lynx games
